content:
Maybe you should have a test case, where the station is not at the end of the list. It is not clear from the statement or the testcases, that the station is a random element of the list.
If u take the last element of the list as the staton, the testcases will go through, but the validations will fail.

Nice! Note nevertheless that this is exactly this https://www.codingame.com/training/easy/the-travelling-salesman-problem (greedy approx. for the TSP) but as a CoC, hence this might be considered too ambitious for 5 min, I don't know though...

I'm going to make it a bit easier than the one I originally created, but it might be difficult for 5 minutes.
Actually, it is possible to solve quite a lot by just finding the distance from one point and sorting. (It is a coincidence)

That's true.
You guess from the test case that you think the station will come last.
The validations also unified the station at the end.
thank you for your comment.
the "all-1" validator is an exception to that currently, so it's a bit bad. i'll edit it
Sorry for the inconvenience. Thank you.
